alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Letcher, Knott, southern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Soft Shell, or near Hindman, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mousie and Ivis around 555 PM EDT. Pippa Passes, Larkslane, Betty, Porter Junction, Mallie and Garret around 600 PM EDT. Estill, Wayland, Raven, Hollybush, Glo, Drew, Nealy, May and Pine Top around 605 PM EDT. Topmost, Kite, Demo, Ivan, Omaha and Minnie around 610 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Buckingham, Dry Creek, Hi Hat, Price, Hall, Orkney, East McDowell, McDowell, Wheelwright, Burton, Halo, Greenleaf, Melvin, Ligon, Buckhorn Hollow, Beaver, Craynor, Jonancy, Virgie, Myra, Speight, Dorton, Beefhide, Galveston and McRoberts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
